item.title: Links (69)
item.author: Nintil
item.description: Various topics are discussed including a review on the role of the microbiome and gut barrier dysfunction in aging, the availability of gene therapy in cream format, rationalists, DOE funding research in cold fusion, building a better NIH, Patrick Collison interviewing Sam Altman, a critique of a16z's State of Crypto report, treating sarcopenia with AAV, and the effects of ultrasound on mice's brains.

item.title: Notes on end-to-end biology
item.author: Nintil
item.content: End-to-end biology, ML in drug discovery, AlphaFold's impact, self-driving car analogy, challenges in understanding biology and future implications for drug development. #biology #ML #drugdiscovery #AlphaFold #selfdrivingcars #understanding #challenges

views.comment: Very curious, what do you think will be the actual impact?

item.title: Bryan Johnson's Blueprint
item.author: Nintil
item.content: Bryan Johnson, founder of Braintree and Kernel recently (a year ago) embarked in what seems one of the most (or perhaps, the most) ambitious program to slow down (and attempt to reverse) aging: Blueprint.
